text.section: In this title the following words have the meanings indicated.

section.section: "Child in need of out-of-state placement" means a child who is recommended by a public agency for out-of-home placement outside of the State.

"Child in need of out-of-state placement" does not include a child:
placed in foster care, as defined in § 5-501 of the Family Law Article; or
who is in a hospital for 30 continuous days or less.

text.section:
"Child with intensive needs" means a child who has behavioral, educational, developmental, or mental health needs that cannot be met through available public agency resources because:
the child's needs exceed the resources of a single public agency; or
there is no legally mandated funding source to meet the child's needs.

"Core service agency" means the designated county or multicounty authority that is responsible for planning, managing, and monitoring publicly funded mental health services as provided under Title 10, Subtitle 12 of the Health - General Article.
"Council" means the State Coordinating Council for Children.
"Evidence-based" means meeting the criteria for an evidence-based early childhood home visiting service delivery model as defined by the federal Department of Health and Human Services.
"Executive Director" means the Executive Director of the Governor's Office for Children.

section.section: "Family" means an eligible child's natural, adoptive, or foster parents.

"Family" includes:
a guardian;
a person acting as a parent of a child; and
a relative or stepparent with whom a child lives.
"Home visiting program" includes those program models identified in the Home Visiting Evidence of Effectiveness project of the federal Department of Health and Human Services.

"Home visiting program" does not include:
programs with few or infrequent visits;
programs in which home visiting is supplemental to other services; or
in-home services delivered through provisions of an individualized family service plan or an individualized education program under Part C or Part B of the federal Individuals with Disabilities Education Act.

text.section: "Hospital" has the meaning stated in § 19-301 of the Health - General Article.

"Local management board" means an entity established or designated by a county under Subtitle 3 of this title to ensure the implementation of a local, interagency service delivery system for children, youth, and families.
"Office" means the Governor's Office for Children.

"Promising" means a home visiting program or practice that:
does not yet meet the standard for evidence-based practices; and
meets the criteria of a promising approach as defined by the federal Department of Health and Human Services.
"Public agency" means a State or local government unit or a quasi-governmental entity.

section.section: "Residential child care program" means an entity that provides 24-hour per day care for children within a structured set of services and activities that are designed to achieve specific objectives relative to the needs of the children served and that include the provision of food, clothing, shelter, education, social services, health, mental health, recreation, or any combination of these services and activities.

"Residential child care program" includes a program:
licensed by:
the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene;
the Department of Human Resources; or
the Department of Juvenile Services; and
that is subject to the licensing regulations of the members of the Children's Cabinet governing the operations of residential child care programs.
